original: yassa vinā nahānena na phāsu hoti. Gilānasamayoti nahāyitabbaṁ.
analyzed: yassa vinā nahānena na phāsu hoti gilāna samayaḥ ti
translated: if he is not comfortable without bathing. The time of being sick: he should bathe.

original: Kammasamayo nāma
analyzed: kamma samayaḥ nāma
translated: The time of working:

original: antamaso pariveṇampi sammaṭṭhaṁ hoti. “Kammasamayo”ti nahāyitabbaṁ.
analyzed: antamasaḥ pariveṇam pi sammaṭṭham hoti kamma samayo ti
translated: if he has swept even just the surrounding area of the dwelling. The time of working: he should bathe.

original: Addhānagamanasamayo nāma
analyzed: addhāna gamana samayaḥ nāma
translated: The time of traveling:

original: “addhayojanaṁ gacchissāmī”ti nahāyitabbaṁ, gacchantena nahāyitabbaṁ, gatena nahāyitabbaṁ.
analyzed: addha yojanam gacchissāmi iti nahāyitabba gacchantena nahāyitabba gatena
translated: if he thinks, “I’ll go one and a half leagues,” he should bathe; if he is going, he should bathe; if he has gone, he should bathe.

original: Vātavuṭṭhisamayo nāma
analyzed: vātavuṭṭhi samayaḥ nāma
translated: The time of storm:

original: bhikkhū sarajena vātena okiṇṇā honti, dve vā tīṇi vā udakaphusitāni kāye patitāni honti. “Vātavuṭṭhisamayo”ti nahāyitabbaṁ.🔽Ūnakaddhamāse ūnakasaññī, aññatra samayā, nahāyati, āpatti pācittiyassa.🔽Ūnakaddhamāse vematiko, aññatra samayā, nahāyati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
analyzed: bhikkhū sara jena vātena okiṇṇāḥ honti dve vā tīṇi vā udaka phusitāni kāye patitāni honti vāta vuṭṭhi samayaḥ ti  ūnaka ddha māse ūnaka saññī aññatra samayā nahāyati āpatti pācittiyassa  ūna kaddha māse vematikaḥ aññatra samayā nahāyati āpatti pācittiyassa
translated: if the monks have been hit by a storm and two or three drops of water have fallen on their bodies. The time of storm: he should bathe.🔽If it is less than a half-month, and he perceives it as less, and he bathes, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: Ūnakaddhamāse atirekasaññī, aññatra samayā, nahāyati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
analyzed: ūna kaddha māse atireka saññī aññatra samayā nahāyati āpatti pācittiyassa
translated: If it is less than a half-month, but he is unsure of it, and he bathes, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.🔽If it is less than a half-month, but he perceives it as more, and he bathes, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: Atirekaddhamāse ūnakasaññī, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
analyzed: atireka addha māse ūnaka saññī āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: If it is more than a half-month, but he perceives it as less, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: Atirekaddhamāse vematiko, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
analyzed: atireka addha māse vematikaḥ āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: If it is more than a fortnight, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: Atirekaddhamāse atirekasaññī, anāpatti.
analyzed: atirekaddha māse atireka saññī anāpatti
translated: If it is more than a fortnight, and he perceives it as more, there is no offense.

original: Anāpatti—🔽samaye,
analyzed: anāpatti  samaye
translated: There is no offense if

original: addhamāsaṁ nahāyati,🔽atirekaddhamāsaṁ nahāyati,
analyzed: addha māsam nahāyati  atirekaddha māsam nahāyati
translated: it is a time when he is bathing every day;🔽if he bathes more than a fortnight;

original: pāraṁ gacchanto nahāyati,🔽sabbapaccantimesu janapadesu,🔽āpadāsu,
analyzed: pāram gacchantaḥ nahāyati  sabba paccantimesu janapadesu  āpadāsu
translated: if he bathes while crossing a river;🔽in the countries beyond the borders;🔽if there are dangers;

original: ummattakassa,
analyzed: ummattakassa
translated: if he is insane;

original: ādikammikassāti.🔽Nahānasikkhāpadaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ sattamaṁ.
analyzed: ādikammikassa ati 🔽nahāna sikkhāpadam niṭṭhitam sattama
translated: if he is the first offender.🔽The training rule on bathing, the seventh, is finished.
